tn.text: Yahweh has just reminded the people of Judah as well as Egypt, Edom, Ammon, Moab and all people that they will be punished.

tn.ref: Do not learn the ways of the nations
tn.text: Do not follow what the heathen nations are believing"
"worried" or "frightened"

tn.ref: by the signs in the heavens
tn.text: "by strange things in the sky"

tn.ref: for the nations are dismayed by these
tn.text: "for the people of the nations are afraid of the strange things they see in the sky" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh has just reminded them not to learn the ways of the nations nor be worried by things that happen in the sky.
a man skilled in his work
A scarecrow is a man-like figure made to scare birds and prevent them from eating the crops. (See: [[: en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
a vegetable that is usually long, with green skin and white flesh that contained much water
Jeremiah has just been talking about idol worship.

tn.ref: Who does not fear you, king of the nations?
tn.text: Jeremiah does not expect an answer to this question. It is more like a statement. AT: "Everyone should fear you, king of the nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"what you have earned"

tn.ref: They are all the same, they are brutish and stupid
tn.text: The words "brutish" and "stupid" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how foolish the people are for worshiping idols. AT: "Every one of them is very stupid." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: disciples of idols that are nothing but wood.
tn.text: "they try to learn from an idol which is just a piece of wood"
"skilled craftsmen"
places where silver and gold are minded

tn.ref: gold from Uphaz made by artificers, the hands of refiners
tn.text: "gold from Uphaz that skilled craftsmen and refiners have made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Their clothes are blue and purple cloth
tn.text: "The people dress the idol in beautiful clothes"
"shakes"
God is speaking to Jeremiah.

tn.ref: The maker of earth in his power established dry land in his wisdom and spread the heavens in his understanding.
tn.text: AT: "The Creator is strong and wise. He made the earth and sky."

tn.ref: His voice makes the roar of waters in the heavens
tn.text: AT: "He controls the storms in the sky by speaking"

tn.ref: and he brings up the mists from the ends of the earth
tn.text: AT: "He makes clouds everywhere on earth."
a building where things are kept
"is lacking knowledge" or "does not know"
"whom the people of Isreal worship"
"the creator of all things" or "the one who created all things"
"Gather your belongings"
The word "See" is to emphasize the following statement.

tn.ref: I am about to throw the inhabitants of the land out this time
tn.text: AT: "I will cause the people living in the land to leave that land."
"people who live in the land"
"great pain or suffering"
Jeremiah is speaking as if he were the whole tribe of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: Woe to me! Because of my broken bones, my wound is infected
tn.text: AT: "We are in deep trouble like a person whose bones are broken and infected." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: My tent is devastated, and all of my tent cords are cut in two
tn.text: The enemy has completely destroyed my city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the enemies have taken"

tn.ref: There is no longer anyone to spread out my tent or to raise up my tent curtains
tn.text: AT: There is no one to rebuild our city." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"are separated and went in different directions"
a type of wild dog found in Africa

tn.ref: Pour your fury on the nations
tn.text: AT: "Punish the people of the nations severely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: devoured Jacob and consumed him so as to completely destroy him
tn.text: Here the words "devour" and "consume" both mean the same thing as "completely destroy." Jeremiah repeats this idea three times to emphasize the utter destruction of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"demolish the land where he lives"
